intro: Scorzonera hispanica var. montana, commonly known as mountain scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features a robust taproot that is often harvested for its edible tubers, which have a nutty flavor. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
